column109:
'review_description': 'My company ordered this product to sync all SAGE records to our salesforce instance via the managed package (one way SAGE -> Salesforce). In addition we wanted the software to (1) Create new accounts in SAGE from Salesforce and (2) Create new Sales Orders in SAGE from Quotes in Salesforce.

Through the first 18 months of this implementation (through June 2018)
column110: the sync stopped working continually. Support would/could not tell me why. I tried to elevate my own case (no response from my sales rep). In January 2018
column111: I was assigned a new account manager to help resolve my issues
column112: but nothing improved. So in June
column113: I posted my frustration here on the app exchange. I was promptly contacted by the management team at Commercient. They explained that they would fix my issues
column114:
and they did. The sync is currently functioning properly.

Pros: When functioning
column115: the software will bring in everything you have in the SAGE tables
column116: and sync periodically (X times per day) to managed custom objects. This unlocks a lot of potential through the Salesforce reporting
column117: automation and alert functionality. We have invested a lot of time in this middleware
column118:
so I am hoping it will run smoothly

Cons: Support is slow to resolve issues. My support tickets have taken 1-2 weeks on average to resolve (sample size 20 tickets). Each time we have a ticket open
column119:
someone must make telecon calls with support so that they can manipulate the on premise software. This can be time-consuming.

The system provides no alert when it stops syncing
column120:
so you must monitor it. Any change to SAGE install or to the SAGE tables syncing can cause it to stop syncing.

Lastly
column121: the software is more expensive than we anticipated. We were surprised that our rates jumped after the first year (we thought we had signed a 3 year contract). A per user model can make this much more expensive than the competitors if you grow.'}
column129: 'review_description': "Commercient has delivered exactly what we needed - all of our Sage data synced to Salesforce. Couldn't be happier. Highly recommend."}

'review_description': 'This is so simple and easy to use yet delivers so much. - (certainly in the use case I used it for).
We collect Alumni information on the web. Rather than a long pick list of years for them to select their "Year of record" they now key the year in.
That text field flows via lead conversion to a text field on the contact record which (using Lookup Helper) automatically populates the Year Look up field on the contact.
It took only a few minutes to set this up compared to the time that would have been involved if we had gone down the traditional path. Luckily for me I started this project after I heard about Lookup Helper - not before.
Greg Devine'}

column279: 'review_title': "Great concept but free version is capped. Upgrade to Enterprise if you're serious."
column281:
you can\'t live without it.

This app allows you to add up totals (say sales $
column282: number of events) in custom fields and show the total. If you have custom objects with business data in Salesforce
column283: or if you integrate Salesforce with your back-end ERP/Accounting system
column285: this is the missing link that allows you to add up all sorts of sales metrics and display them in a field in the account. I.e.
column288: number of event type "customer visit" in the last 12 months
column289: number of support hours left on customer account
column290:
total amount of past due invoices etc.

And the summarized field triggers workflows. So if you want an email to be automatically sent to any customers who reach X dollars past due or who run out of pre-paid support hours
column291:
this app triggers the workflow for it. Oh yeah.

You may say "Salesforce has a feature that does that - Roll-up summary fields!" But it\'s way too limited: the summaries don\'t work for event/task data
column292: don\'t work for formulas which involve a date variable (i.e.
column294:
year-to-date opportunity $ closed) and the summarized data doesn\'t trigger workflows.

This app overcomes all those issues.

We installed the free edition right after this app was launched
column295: in September 2012. The developers however crippled the free version over time. This is understandable since they need to keep costs down for this version. By crippling I mean capping the amount of data that can be added up. If you\'re summing one data field from Cases into Accounts (say support hours used) you\'ll be fine with this version. If however you\'re importing thousands of invoices and hundreds of thousands of invoice line items (in custom objects) and adding them up to hundreds of accounts - well
column296:
then you\'ll need the Enterprise edition.

5 stars for the life-changing functionality. 3 stars for capping data usage. 4-star final grade.'}
column304: 'review_description': 'This app pretty cool

But
column306: overall is cool as it do not need master-detail for rollup.'}
column314: 'review_description': 'We discovered this tool when it was newly released. Now it is getting better and better. It is a true helper for admin.'}
column322: 'review_description': "This is a must have app. On the account object you can only rollup on opportunities with this great tool you create rollups on cases
column324: custom objects etc. It's easy to use
column325:
create a 'number' field go to the settings of rollup helper and map the rollup trigger to the new field.

We also created a formula to calculate the fillpercentage of an account

column335:
'review_description': "Update 1/7/13:

After a recent pushed update the roll ups stopped working for us. I tried to create a new one and that didn't work either. I did contact support
column336: but after a week and a half it still wasn't working and I broke down and had the roll up coded (the old way). I'm sure they would have figured this out eventually
column337:
but I need my data to be accurate and can't wait for that.

I hope to re-consider this app and adjust my review in the future when it matures a bit. This needs to at least support the filters that standard roll-up fields support.

********
I was thinking of making this tool
column338:
but I'm glad you did it! It works like charm and will save organizations from having to create a bunch of one-off rollup triggers.

The Enterprise version is price is extremely fair too. The only thing I would suggest is that you support filters so that we don't have to build formula fields for conditions. Perhaps that would be a paid only feature.

Good work!"}]

column3: 'reviewer_name': 'Fruit of the Loom Business Systems Analyst'
column7: 'review_title': 'Effectively Track Trade Promotions and Settlements with one convenient solution!'
column8:
'review_description': '“As a Business Systems Analyst – I have worked with CPG Toolbox for our company’s Trade Promotion needs. The system has been great in allowing us to effectively track trade spend and plan our promotions with ease. The settlement process has saved significant time in allowing us to efficiently create and distribute our credit memo’s and track deductions. The reporting feature is very user friendly and has allowed us to provide our finance team with up to date trade spend reports.

CPG Toolbox provides exceptional support
column9: guidance
column10:
and product enhancements. They have been very understanding of our business needs and have incorporated some of our requests into their core product.

The CPG Toolbox solution permitted us to replace two different 3rd party trade applications with a single Salesforce solution to track all of our trade spend events. We achieved an overall cost and manpower savings while gaining significant planning and reporting functionality. CPG Toolbox has been a profitable partnership."'}
column21:
CPG has provided me with many benefits.
1. One place to record deductions/cheque request by account with the capability to attach the debit/invoice
2. Reports that can be pulled relating to deductions in various ways (open
column23:
or where in the approval flow they are sitting)
3. Reports show the deductions aging used for month end reporting to finance
4. Reps can pull their own reports for just their accounts at any time
5. Month end reports showing all closed items to balance back to our financial system
6. The reports have made it easier for me to provide financial clearing information to my AR department
7. All supporting documentation for the deduction or cheque request can be attached and is maintained in one place
8. Chatter and Following an item has been a great way for reps to keep me informed if they are disputing a debit
column24:
I can then in turn advise AR why we are not clearing the deduction
9. Tying a payment directly to a specific program and being able to track this in the system


Before CPG an excel file had to be maintained by myself for the recording of all deductions. A separate system was used to process and clear the deductions or request the cheques. No reports could be pulled to see where in the process we were sitting. When deductions were cleared I would have to manually remove them from one tab on excel to a closed tab. The reps would also keep track of their payments separately on their own excel reports against various programs. With the reports they can retrieve in CPG they no longer need to do this.

I believe CPG has provided time saving benefits for both myself in finance and the reps and has eliminated duplication in many ways.

As for my contacts at CPG – they are great to work with
column28: and give you guidance. Truly enjoy working with them.'}]

column81: 'review_title': 'Techies With In Depth Knowledge of Manufacturing Process'
column82:
'review_description': 'Unionwear.com is a domestic manufacturer of headwear and bags. We went live with Rootstock on 1/1/2014. We are extremely happy with our decision and want to share our experience.

We decided upon a cloud-based solution for ERP
column83: and after exploring two other popular integrated suites
column84:
we met with Rootstock and engaged them a month later. The Rootstock salespeople completely spoke the language of manufacturing. I felt like they knew more about our business processes than we did—everyone in the company understands manufacturing IT.

When we asked Rootstock if their system could do something
column85: they either proved that it could
column86: or they added it to their roadmap for future releases. Almost everything on those roadmaps has now been added. I deal with about 20 different people at Rootstock; each of them brings something different to the table
column87:
but they all help. They all understand the role of technology in manufacturing.

During the first step in implementation
column88: someone from Rootstock discusses and maps your business processes. You then put some dummy data into your Sandbox and model all the transactions. Once you’re happy with the Sandbox
column89: you can move into production mode. We had a big job in gathering
column91:
but we leaned on Rootstock throughout the process.

We signed the contract in August
column93:
testing in October and training in November and December. We went live on January 1st.

Our workforce have had no issues adopting Rootstock; it’s designed so that an order cannot be shipped without going through the workflow that we’ve set up.

Rootstock issues updates almost every week. We are using Rootstock in ways that differ from companies that manufacture electrical circuits or mix paint
column94: so we’ve done some workarounds. After updates
column96: but the support process is simple
column98: and fluid. We log a case

able to help launch a small business's growth into the mid-market.

We implemented Rootstock well over a year ago
column116:
we're confident Rootstock provides the solid foundation necessary for our next phase of significant growth. Their integration with Financial Force and development on the salesforce.com platform have allowed financial management of our supply chain to be closely tied across the rest of the company.

Rèmond and Dean ensured an effective implementation from the start
column117: taking the time to learn and understand our business from pilot through full deployment. They have continued to remain involved

column119:
they carry through on Rootstock's commitment to continue elevating the performance of our company's supply chain.

Ultimately Rootstock provides the ERP structure necessary for a rapidly growing mid-market enterprise to deliver on its promise to customers and investors."}

column163: 'review_title': 'The Back Office is Now in the Cloud'
column164: 'review_description': "Rootstock's team of engineers and consultants bring deep knowledge of manufacturing and software processes to the table. Leveraging the full power of the force.com platform
column166: in combination with their FinancialForce.com integration
column167: brings the back office to the Salesforce world with an unprecedented feature set that
column168: together with our own custom software built on the force.com platform
column169: allows us to build our entire end-to-end enterprise software solution in the cloud. Inventory
column172:
and WCP are key elements to making our back office a success and Rootstock brings it all in a well-integrated fashion. This isn't manufacturing lite. This is the real thing - now in the cloud. The time has come for the cloud to challenge what has traditionally been an on-premise solution and Rootstock is the team who is taking it there for the force.com community.

As Rootstock's first force.com customer to be implemented
column173: we have seen first hand the expertise not just of the founders of Roostock
column174: but of the entire team they have assembled on both the software development side of things and the implementation support and consulting aspects of their business. We are excited by the fact that we were able to implement an entirely new financial system including the kind of robust feature set previously only available from legacy vendors configured as on-premise solutions in only 6 months from pilot to go live. While I am sure this will vary from implementation to implementation
column175: what you are getting with Rootstock Software is not just the platform for growth
column176: but also the team who will get you there every step of the way."}
column184: 'review_description': 'As we are working through the testing and pre-implementation phases of implementing Rootstock
column185: working with the Rootstock Professional Services (Remond and Rob in particular) has been nothing short of outstanding. I understand the complexity of ERP software designed for many users and am impressed with the prompt and thorough responses provided to questions
column186:
issues and troubleshooting. In each situation the answers received have been thorough and I have always been kept up to date on fixes and updates in the pipeline.

I am looking forward to using Rootstock in full production as I believe it will help us in multiple areas of our organization'}
column194: 'review_description': "We are about 1/3rd of the way through our implementation of Rootstock and our Implementation team has far exceeded my expectations. Many thanks to Dean
column196:
Dan & Rob! They are extremely knowledgeble of all things related to Manufacturing as well as SalesForce. I have yet to find a problem which they haven't been able to solve very quickly.

We chose Rootstock because of the many features offered in the App which were not available in other solutions. Our legacy system is about to self destruct
column197: so we were in the market for a full ERP/MRP replacement. Our company tried and tested several manufacturing apps in the cloud
column200:
the best app for our needs.

Our implementation team has taken the time to understand our business and processes. They completely understand the Lean Manufacturing mentality and have guided us to structure our set up accordingly. They are organized and thorough
column201: and have kept us headed down the right path. As the SalesForce administrator and Financial Controller of our company
column202: I am completely happy so far with our choice of Rootstock and our progress to date."}
column210: 'review_description': "I've worked with Rootstock for a couple of years now and have been consistently impressed by the team's domain expertise and professionalism. Pat and his team have been a pleasure to work with and are a valued partner of FinancialForce.com . We look forward to continued success together as the adoption of the force.com platform in the manufacturing vertical rapidly gathers momentum."}
column218: 'review_description': "I am pleased to be the first one to write a review for Rootstock. Although new to the platform these guys have lived and breathed manufacturing and supply apps for years! As a partner of Rootstocks I have had the benefit of seeing firsthand what their products can do. Often times we talk about the 360 degree of a customer well Rootstock provides you a 360 degree view of your plant operations. Check it out! You won't be disappointed!!"}]

column69: 'review_title': 'SCM: We were sold a product that wasn’t baked.'

that was somehow our burden.

column1647: 'review_description': "Bizible is on the leading edge of marketing attribution for all sizes of businesses- but they are affordable for any sized company. The dashboards are just amazing and help optimize campaigns as well as make you look like a hero!"}]

column84: 'review_title': 'Shot myself in the foot but they helped me undo it'
column85: 'review_description': 'We\'ve been trying this out for awhile now for our small organization. We track donations in kind and then donate it to clients. I noticed we never used "Inventory" tab and so decided to uninstall it. Little did I realize that RIO was connected to our Products and that "Quantity on Hand" field came from RIO Inventory. I lost it all! Thankfully
column86: my shot in the dark email to support got a response. She helped me walk through how to get it back. I\'m back in business and will not have to recount everything!'}

column59: 'review_description': 'We are a growing high tech instrumentation company with a focus on PDA based handheld instrumentation. Focusing on customer satisfaction has been a key ingredient to our success and depends a great deal on our ability to fulfill the customer’s needs in a timely manner. We build our systems to order and are usually able to ship on the same day we receive the order. Almost all of our products are shipped within 24 hours of the order. To achieve this objective of rapid shipment
column61: we need to have accurate data that is easy to interpret on a system used by diverse personnel ranging from management
column64:
production and shipping.

We were looking at creating custom applications in Salesforce to manage Order Fulfillment. We were using Mail Merge and email templates for Quotes
column67: Pack List and RMAs. Mail Merge and email templates
column68:
while useful were a bit cumbersome because we have a mix of Mac and PC computers and there are a lot of extra steps required for the Mac users because none of the automation Salesforce built into Outlook could be used by our Sales personnel.

The Glovia system eliminates all the extra steps by having buttons that turn Opportunities into Quotes
column69:
Quotes into Sales Orders and Sales Orders into shipping orders and documentation. At each stage there is a button to simply email the pdf form. Initially we took the unnecessary step of working in a Sandbox. Glovia integrates over the top of the existing Salesforce framework without stepping all over our current customizations. This means that development can be done on the production environment and exposed when you are ready to switch over.

Our next steps will be to customize the documents
column70: link the data to Quickbooks and our Order Fulfillment house’s database so we can view our entire sales to fulfillment process and inventory in a singular place and reduce the time spent managing inventory in Quickbook’s limited GUI.'}

column445:
'review_description': "FunnelSource is easily one of my favorite Apps. And like most Apps it comes down to the product and the service.

This App takes the work of dozens (or hundreds) of sales reports and boils it down into an interface that sales management and sales reps can use as their base of operations for Opportunities.
The value to the Sales team is immense. Pipeline/Forecast meetings can be run in one interface that tells managers and reps how they're doing against their goals
column446:
how they're doing against their team or other teams and where they need to improve.

If there are actions sales leadership wants to drive
column447:
the interface can reflect those.

In the last 6 years I've used Salesforce for Sales teams in two different companies with two very different distribution structures. I've been a part of building the reports that Funnelsource has built-in so I understand
column448:
from an administrators point of view the work this app saves in pure build-time. But it does more than just save you time in building reports.

The native Salesforce model for sales reporting is a 20-Report Dashboard you tweak as you drill down into your team's metrics until you end up in rabbit holes so deep you forget the point. In contrast
column449:
the FunnelSource model is to show you all pertinent metrics at once and filter them as you drill down. The interface is easily the most consolidated view of actionable metrics related to your Opportunity Pipeline/Forecast that you can fit on a single screen.

---- Service:
Of all the Salesforce Vendors I've worked with
column450:
I've never come across anyone as excited to jump on the phone make sure we're set up to achieve our goals.

We've never had an issue that wasn't able to be solved in 15-20 minutes with a phone call. I'd trust these guys with my first born.

Funnelsource is a must-have for any company big enough to need a Pipeline/Forecast management tool."}

column1375:
'review_description': 'There are few tools you will find easier to use. FunnelSource allow your sales team to see where they are at on one screen. The information is presented in such a way your sales staff will use the tool more often and the data accuracy will improve. The one complaint you always hear from sales people when using CRM tools is that it takes to much time to manage. SalesForce goes a long way to take away those excuses and FunnelSource remove the rest of the obstacles. For Management the top down view is best I have ever seen in a tool. You can conduct account reviews and find data all on one screen. Funnel source eliminates the need from managing the team through screens of Dash Boards.

I recommend FunnelSource to anyone interested in optimizing their sales staff to improve utilization and data accuracy. With FunnelSource it is all right there in front of you. column1411:
'review_description': "All executives know that one of the keys to sales is successful forecasting. FunnelSource allows you to keep track of your targets all on one screen.

Sales Reps can drive business on a daily basis and navigate there priorities easily. This is a true road-map to success for any sales rep.
The Funnel Race adds a nice touch to this application and supports keeping everyone on their toes.
The price is also very realistic for what you are getting. No hidden fees or additional bolt on for additional dollars.
Finally and application that puts all of the important information right at your fingertips.
I would recommend this application to anyone who wants to be successful and stay on target."}

column21: 'review_description': 'I had the good fortune to beta test Groundwire Engage a couple of months before it was officially released. Engage is powerful (and customizable!) and is helping my organization gain visibility into who are our most engaged constituents
column22: and who\'s moving up and down. The mechanics of installing the app are fairly quick
column23: but to do so you need to have already defined the engagement levels for your organization. Fortunately
column24: Groundwire provides some helpful documents for how to go about establishing your organization\'s levels of engagement
column25:
but it does require your organization to do some strategic thinking if you haven\'t already figured out your engagement pyramid.

What\'s the value of all of this? Well
column26: I just used Engage today to identify a list of fundraising prospects
column27: based on their level of engagement. And this was SO much easier than having to sift through all 100+ of our campaigns! We\'ve only been on Salesforce for about 6 months
column28: so thankfully we don\'t have hundreds or thousands of campaigns to deal with yet. (But if we did
column29: then Engage would have been even more helpful!) By doing all of the calculations in the background

column24: 'review_title': 'Network filters only available for some components'
column25:
'review_description': 'We have 5 communities and only SOME dashboard components are filtered to represent data specific to the community dashboard you are viewing via a dynamic Network filter (ie. the Network ID of the community)

For example--
Dashboard component: "Community Searches 2.0" - Searches with No Results (30 Days)
The report renders aggregate results for the community you are viewing!!! It shows the search results for ALL communities combined.

Dashboard component: "Daily Active Users" - Report "Network User Daily Participation"
You HAVE the availability of linked filters or dynamic filters.

Why do some dashboard components have a nice dynamic per community filter and others do not????

It would be great if the dynamic network filter feature was available for all dashboard components in the package. My community moderators only want to see dashboards relevant to the community they are viewing and managing.

Please fix this error. I\'m sure all users of this package would appreciate it.'}

column132: 'review_description': "We engaged Commercient for their Sync capability to support our JD Edwards system. We utilized Sync to synchronize Account
column134:
and Product records to Salesforce. We also use their feature that supports exporting records that can be imported into JDE. They synch from JDE to Salesforce is a managed package. You work with Commercient to define exactly what data you want brought into Salesforce via a query definition. These records are then created and maintained in Salesforce.

The export is somewhat more complicated to design
column135:
but the interface once built is straight forward creating export CSV files from Salesforce that can be used for importing into the JD Edwards system via additional software development on the JDE system. We created Account and Quote exports for our system.

I don't want to downplay the complexity in some of these design integration activities
column136: but Commercient was a great partner who worked patiently with us to get our system functioning properly. Once you have both sets of these features setup you have the technical basis needed to support 2 way round trip synchronization between these systems."}

Thanks to Commercient I will have some impressive things to show my sales team at the quarterly meeting that will help drive swift adoption of SalesForce.'}

Commercient changed the game for us and has been a tremendous value added partner throughout the process as we moved to a fully integrated solution. column297:
'review_description': "Where Commercient differs from other integration providers is in the depth of the integration and that they do all the heavy lifting for you. It's one thing to just push the customer table to Salesforce. It's another to make sure it syncs to the right accounts. And it's yet another to create sophisticated views of your data (pulling information from several tables) and push them neatly and digested to one object in Salesforce.

The first implementation that we used Commercient was a couple years ago. We integrated Syspro with SQL database with Salesforce
column298: pushing several tables with relevant account info. Mainly invoices
column301: equipment (assets) but also sophisticated SQL views. With further formula fields
column302: this info allowed us to give users a full view of what's going on in each customer. Receivables
column303:
average qty sold per week etc.

The sophisticated views looked at recent sales in our database. For every product
column304: it looked up in multiple database tables what was the list price
column305: what price the customer was getting
column306: was that because of a flat contract price or discount %
column308:
what discount the customer would be eligible for given their actual volume. And then it presented that data in Salesforce in a single related list.

Note that Commercient can also go beyond the Salesforce integration - as a separate optional service. Once we had it tap into your database
column309: we also wanted to send customers email notifications with their order info. Formatting an HTML email with line item info (i.e. data from child objects) and lots of formula calculations goes beyond what you can do in Salesforce with the built-in email templates. So we worked with Commercient to execute that . As our users put in orders and invoices
column310:
customers automagically got email notifications of their orders.

I have worked with part of the Commercient team since 2009 as they were our Syspro reseller. The team and support are solid."}
column318: 'review_description': 'The app has helped our company sync our ERP system to salesforce and is helping our business operate more efficiently by allowing the sales team one interface. The Commercient service has been responsive and knowledgeable. We will work with them again in the future.'}
column326: 'review_description': 'We have been using this app for a year now with great success. The customer service team from Commercient is first rate
column327: working non stop to fix any issue that we might encounter. If you are looking to sync your ERP system with Salesforce
column328: this is the perfect app to get the job done!'}]

column8: 'review_description': 'I have been working with Kenandy for almost three years
column9: and have been a part of the core IT functional team for two Kenandy implementations at my organization. I have seen a successful Kenandy implementation at one of our smaller individual business units that replaced off-the-shelf ERP software that had limited capabilities. I then saw another successful Kenandy implementation across our larger organization
column10: while replacing a much older and customized ERP solution
column11:
with a high cost of ownership.

I would recommend Kenandy to organizations seeking to execute their company strategies through enabling business capabilities and agile business processes
column12: while realizing the benefits of operating in the cloud and on the Salesforce platform. Through partnership with Kenandy
column13: I’ve seen first-hand the implementation of business processes that took years to develop in the legacy world
column14:
in a number of months. End users have told me that information is very easily accessible and the ease of navigation and reporting empowers them to make better and faster business decisions.

Supporting the object configuration and data environment is very manageable. The support staff at Kenandy are very bright individuals and will work with you to ensure successful results.'}
column22: 'review_description': 'I have found Kenandy to be the most full-featured ERP on the Salesforce platform. I have implemented Kenandy for two companies and I am currently working on a third. The users find Kenandy extremely easy to navigate. They tell me that Kenandy saves them time throughout their day. Kenandy is easy to configure and to maintain. They are adding new features regularly which continue to streamline business processes. My prior experience was that of an SAP consultant and I find Kenandy much easier to work with. The fact that it is native to the Salesforce platform means that it can easily work with other applications on the App Exchange. I have seen it working for large customer with EDI and Tibco integrations and smaller customers with very few interfaces. It is very flexible and the Kenandy team is great to work with! I highly recommend Kenandy ERP to any firm looking to streamline their business processes.'}
column30: 'review_description': 'We have been using Kenandy for a few years now have dozens of users banging on it each day from our offices in San Francisco and Shenzhen. We are glad that we chose them as our ERP partner
column31: especially after hearing about the challenges of implementing on-premise solutions from Oracle or SAP. The team at Kenandy has been supportive and knowledgeable throughout the relationship.'}
column39: 'review_description': "Kanandy's salesforce is easy to learn and extremely useful in seeing real-time data which is vital in any manufacturing based company. I would gladly recommend this platform to anyone."}
column46: 'review_title': 'User Friendly and Your Business Information at Your Finger Tips'
column47: 'review_description': 'This platform delivers exactly what they say it will. In my 30+ years in operations I never had this type of information so easily available. If there is anything out there better it must be on the drawing board. Anyone in the organization can quickly see how much faster information is available to you. Even better that you can see it anywhere in the world from your phone. Rarely does anyone in an executive role want to be disconnected from your workplace. With this Salesforce platform there is no need for calling anyone on your days off to check on the anything. You have every departments real time information available to you. Great team to work with on the implementation.'}
column54: 'review_title': 'Take your business to the next level'
column55: 'review_description': 'Moving to Kenandy from a locally hosted ERP system has allowed us to have the data we need to run our business at our fingertips. We are no longer concerned with how we will get the data but rather what the data is telling us and how we will use the data to make better and faster decisions. The system has been easy to configure and allows us to make the changes we need to better streamline our company and automate tasks we do on a regular basis. The team at Kenandy has been very helpful and open to design recommendations.'}
column63: 'review_description': 'The salesforce platform has enabled businesses to become more agile in they way they operate. Moving to cloud erp on force.com eliminates the legacy challenges and allowed us to focus on quickly growing and extending functionality to sales
column66: and analytics by having our core business running on the platform.'}
column74: 'review_description': 'If you are looking for a new ERP system. Kenandy is worth your time to review is functionality. We have been using Kenandy for the past two years and we are very happy with our decision. Ours come from companies using SAP and Oracle and they find Kenandy much easier to use. We have also integrated several other applications that have helped us to manage the business easier and faster.'}
column82: 'review_description': 'For any small - medium size company looking to take control of their manufacturing system with a group of individuals who know what they are doing
column83: Kenandy needs to be the first call that you make. If you have an existing system
column84: process or legacy pieces that are preventing you from manufacturing velocity
column88:
integrated financials and effective management oversight for your manufacturing environment Kenandy is for you.

The internal team we have working on our implementation has experience with BaaN
column94:
Epicor Manage 2000 and a couple of other MRP solutions ranging from small ($20M) to very large scale ($22B). Out team regularly points to all of the failed or late implementations that they\'ve worked on in the past. We have many "war" stories and "nightmares" associated with implementations to share.........and I can tell you we\'ve not added to that very long of issue because we are dealing with the "right" solution. None of the traditional pitfalls exist inside the Kenandy relationship. These folks know what they are doing and they have Manufacturing in their DNA.

We are a small startup with significant projected growth in the coming year AND we are very confident that Kenandy will evolve with our needs and create a success story for both organizations over the next couple of years. There is nothing in the marketplace today that would have allowed us to achieve our goals while supporting our growth needs all in one. As an additional note
column95: I had recommended Kenandy to another local company of similar profile and they decided to go with another. Well
column96:
their implementation has been a train wreck; their costs have skyrocketed and they are not getting the support as initially indicated.......we\'ve seen none of these issues......Ecstatic!

We have a long way to go
column97: but are far along the path to success.'}

column299: 'review_title': 'Great Alternative for File Storage within SalesForce'
column300: 'review_description': "We were looking for an alternative to the native SalesForce file storage. We specifically wanted a tool that used the Amazon S3 cloud. S-Drive fits the bill well. Installation can be a bit of a challenge with all the customization that must be done to scripts. However
column301: once you get the hang of it with a few objects
column302: it becomes pretty intuitive for everything else. In addition
column303:
I couldn't have asked for a more responsive customer service.

There are just a few things that would make S-Drive even better. Some of these might not be possible with S3
column304:
but it doesn't hurt to ask.

1. The ability to create password protected links. I have some customers whom I would love to use S-Drive to send email links to. However
column305: because I can't password protect those links
column306:
they refuse to download files using S-Drive links.

2. The ability to rename and move files/folders without having to delete and recreate.

3. The ability to track who actually uses the link provided to download a particular file.

Otherwise
column315: 'review_description': "S-Drive requires a little bit of custom work inside of Salesforce to apply it to standard objects and a bit more for custom objects. I am not a programmer
column316: but was able to walk through this. When I got stuck
column317: support was very responsive and got me moving right away. We have had a couple nominal hiccups
column318:
but support has always been right on top of delivering a fix. I think I may have already worked out many of the bugs for you!

Definitely the best value for this service available. If you don't mind a little bit of work on your end
column319:
it will save you in the long run.

Only complaint is the main S-Drive directory requires flash. Will not work if your browser (i.e. iPad) does not support flash."}
column328: 'review_description': "I cannot say enough about the support for S-drive. They've been incredibly responsive to our questions throughout our implementation process

column330: and provides exactly the functionality that we needed. Pricing is very reasonable and we've had no issues in terms of the amazon billing. GREAT app. I would highly recommend it to anyone who is considering them."}
column338: 'review_description': 'We all know Salesforce gives a relatively piddly amount of file storage space
column339:
and some of the solutions here in the AppExchange are far too expensive for me to refer to my clients. S-Drive is a miracle.

The pricing is the best you\'re going to find on the AppExchange as of today. Ease of use for the end users is top-notch and it acts like a native part of Salesforce right out of the "box."

BEST PART: Custom field integration is a total snap. For example
column340: I have a custom picklist on my files identifying which type of document it is (Document A
column341: Document B) and run workflows off this information (e.g. Client XYZ submitted Document A
column342: check!). Just add the custom field per normal to the corresponding custom object (e.g. AccountFile is the default custom object for a file attached to an account)
column343: go to the S-Drive Configuration tab
column344:
and make it a visible field. BAM.

Documentation is very thorough (and you can read through it before you install). The install PDF looks daunting at first glance
column345: but it\'s a breeze to go through
column346:
and if you know how to do basic admin tasks like create a custom object (and/or if you\'re only using this with existing standard objects) then you can skip most sections.

One small comment: You have to follow the "View" page override instructions in the custom object section to get the included standard objects (Account
column348: etc.) to work. I dove right in without reading the instructions
column349: figuring I just had to add a related list
column350:
and was wrong.

The only downside is there\'s a couple extra clicks -- I assume there\'s a reason. For example
column351: you have to click "OK" to start selecting files and have to click "Upload" instead of each file uploading as you select it. Really tiny grievance
column352: and I bet there\'s a good reason for it in the background.'}
column361: 'review_description': "We were running into areas where the 5MB attachment was limit was lowering our capacity to work. I had look into various solutions

Thanks!"}

column25: 'review_description': "Our first use case for Rollup Helper was to eliminate some of the custom code in our org. column26:
and also making sure that the most recent activity came from a specific business unit.

We asked passage tech support to remove the default contact trigger that runs rampant on our system

'review_description': "I have used the roll up helper in a few SF orgs.
It solves 2 major pain points of a modern SaaS company:
1. Having multiple active opps for a single account - thanks to roll up we can see the total ARR.
2. Having a multi touch sales process for each lead - roll up makes sure we understand all the interactions we've had at the lead\\contact level.

The 5th star is for having a super awesome support team - even though I explicitly said I am on the free tier they were responsive and solved my issues."}
column164: 'review_description': 'Our small organization was faced with a problem of trying to rollup unique values from a lookup object to a Contact record. We first tried Rollup Helper alone which rolled up the values
column165: but couldn’t rollup only the unique ones. The support team suggested that the problem might be solved with both Rollup and Lookup Helper. In a very generous
column167: a team of solution experts showed me how to do it with the creation of a custom object
column168: two lookups and two rollups. I was very impressed with both the expertise of the support team and how the two products could complement each other to synthesize data.'}
column177: 'review_description': 'Rollups of many standard objects to each other (like Contact rollups to the Account level) are not supported for some reason in SFDC. The filters are easy to implement and the tool includes a field create button on the object so you can easily create a new field from within the Rollup helper UI for the target object without having to navigate away to the setup. I am using the free version & it does everything I need it to
column178: as long as I can stay in the rollup limit.'}

column736:
'review_description': "The user experience from trial to installation has been seamless. Lisa was extremely helpful in making certain that Passage and our SF community connected. Now for the techie stuff:

The Roll Up Helper is a must for roll-up intensive SF orgs. It's a great way around the clunky limitations imposed by SF on roll up summaries

column741: make certain and grab this one."}

column2610:
'review_description': 'We had Rollup Helper for 6 months now and we were very much looking forward to all the use cases the tool is said to cover. 6 months later we are still struggling with the workings of our rollups. The issues continue around:

- Not all records update during scheduled updates.
- No visibility into which records successfully updated and which ones got stuck. Basically we have to check each record manually via reporting to see whether the update went through correctly.
- Every upgrade seems to be breaking or clashing with the existing functionality
- Insufficient support. Even for the highest priority cases (affecting all Salesforce users) there is no sense of urgency for resolution and it takes weeks/months to get any single issue resolved

We would have loved to leave another glowing review here but as great as this tool is in theory as painful it has been for us to actually use it.'}

This app allows you to add up totals (say sales $
column3153: number of events) in custom fields and show the total. If you have custom objects with business data in Salesforce

column3156: this is the missing link that allows you to add up all sorts of sales and performance metrics and display them in a field in the account. I.e.

total amount of past due invoices etc.

And the summarized field triggers workflows. So if you want an email to be automatically sent to any customers who reach X dollars past due or who run out of pre-paid support hours
column3162:
the field summarized by this app triggers the workflow for it. Oh yeah.

You may say "Salesforce has a feature that does that - Roll-up summary fields!" But it\'s way too limited: the summaries don\'t work for event/task data

year-to-date opportunity $ closed) and the summarized data doesn\'t trigger workflows.

This app overcomes all those issues.

We installed the free edition right after this app was launched
column3166: in September 2012. But had to upgrade to the paid enterprise edition when they capped the data usage in the free edition. If you\'re summing one data field from Cases into Accounts (say support hours used) you\'ll be fine with this version. If however you\'re importing thousands of invoices and hundreds of thousands of invoice line items (in custom objects) and adding them up to hundreds of accounts - well
column3167:
then you\'ll need the Enterprise edition.

5 stars for the life-changing functionality. It ain\'t cheap
column3168: but enables you to automate a LOT of back office work.'}
column3175: 'review_title': 'This is a must-have app for Salesforce Admins!'
column3176: 'review_description': 'Rollup Helper is a tremendous value and I highly recommend the paid version for Salesforce admins. While it does overcome the rollup summary field limit Salesforce imposes
column3177: which in itself makes it worthwhile
column3178: what makes it invaluable is that it can do so much more than a standard rollup field. The Salesforce admin will no longer be constrained by the source field type – you can do a rollup on other rollups
column3180: even text fields if you just want a list or subset list to appear on the parent record. And it doesn’t have to be a Master-Detail relationship
column3181: it will work on your lookup relationships too. You can use most any field as a criterion to filter your rollup. So for those clicks-vs.-code types out there (like me) and for those who don’t want to spend the time
column3183: and effort writing code to overcome the Salesforce limits
column3184:
this app is a must-have.

As for service
column3185: the team at Passage Tech is very responsive. If you need help getting started (I’m not suggesting you will; the interface is pretty intuitive)
column3186: they are just a phone call or email away. For complicated cases
column3187: an engineer will help you map it out
column3190:
put through the change set into your production environment.

We tested the free app first
column3191: and then quickly migrated to the paid version and put our two rollups into real time – including a text rollup. We then tried our most complex use case (thinking if we can get this one to work
column3192: the other 5 cases will be easy). Our use case spanned 6 objects
column3194: 5 of which were rollup fields for which we used Rollup Helper. It included two custom junction objects
column3199: master-detail relationships and lookup relationships – and with some mapping
column3200: a couple conversations with an engineer
column3201:
we tested the result and have it up and running.

For the price
column3202: I highly recommend this app for Salesforce admins.'}

column23: 'review_title': 'Getting a leading zero when scanning a numeric barcode'
column24:
'review_description': 'I have installed barcode zone in a salesforce dev org winter 14. I am able to generate and scan the barcode generated. The problem is that if I have an all numeric barcode (ex: 12345) I get a leading 0 when scanned (012345). This is being generated in a pdf. The code I am using is in a component and is as follows.

<BarcodeZone:ACBarcodeZone Value="{!\'12345\'}"
BrcdType="{!\'code128\'}"
BrcdHeight="40"
/>

Now if I make the value alphanumeric like 12345ABCDE everything works fine. When scanned I get 12345ABCDE.

<BarcodeZone:ACBarcodeZone Value="{!\'12345ABCDE\'}"
BrcdType="{!\'code128\'}"
BrcdHeight="40"
/>

I’ve tried the code39 and that won’t scan and ean13 doesn’t even show up in the pdf.

I am really looking to use code128 with numerics only.

Any help would be appreciated.'}

column85: 'review_title': 'BarCode is Creating problem with critical update of salesforce'
column87:
There is new critical update in salesforce named "Generate correctly escaped markup". According to this mark up :
"Prior to the Winter ’13 release
column88: text in some Visualforce pages and components might have been generated incorrectly. This markup could contain fragments that should have been escaped (for example
column89:
the "<" character generated as "<") but were not. These fragments might be interpreted by the browser as markup rather than as text in the page. This problem has been corrected for all pages with API version 26.0 or later."

So
column90: when I activated this Update then it is creating problem in barcode. HTML table is showing instead of Barcode. please fix this issue as soon as possible.'}

column7: 'review_title': 'Excellent Safety Management tool for Express Glass'
column8:
'review_description': 'Michael and the team have supplied Express Glass with a great solution to managing and improving safety for our team and customers. Express Glass is a leading emergency glass replacement company that services all of Australia. Express Glass responds to emergencies that present unique safety challenges that require practical mobile solutions.
The Health & Safety Automation app compliments our Field Service Lighting app to bring both efficient and safe delivery of our service. The health and safety automation app provides the glazier with the tools and resources needed to achieve a better safety outcome and best of all the information is on the same platform - no need for our techs to have multiple systems to login to.
The ease of recording near misses
column9: incidents and inspections has resulted in more data being recorded and as a result
column10:
greater volumes of preventative actions are identified and implemented
There are lots of elements to our safety system and the system UI is very intuitive (users don’t require days and days of training and can get started and see real benefit from the beginning).
Michael and the team were very responsive and accommodating to the needs of Express Glass
column11:
Michael managed the project from start to end in a professional way and I would highly recommend this product to other field service companies looking for a solution to manage health and Safety

Reece van Vliet
Head of Operations
Express Glass'}

column39: 'review_title': 'Ability to Report on Custom Objects was Critical'
column40: 'review_description': 'We needed a solution to supplement SFDC reporting. Originally
column41: we selected LucidEra but when the company went under we had to look at other options. We compared several available options and in the end
column42: we went with PivotLink because it can pull data from multiple sources
column43:
giving us deeper clarity into our business and it is easy to use. The ability to aggregate disparate types of data and transform it into something the end-user can easily consume was important for us.

PivotLink allows us to report on custom objects
column44: reduces a lot of the manual work we were doing with regards to report generation
column45: and overall improves our speed to insight. The report interface is very straight-forward and it’s easy to customize reports and dashboards. My executive team loves the way data is presented and it allows us to eliminate the manual process of rolling stuff up into Excel. Having worked with multiple BI tools
column46: I’ve spent time waiting for results
column47: but so far this is much faster. As what we build becomes more and more complex
column48:
this will become a critical success factor.

Our IT group was involved in our decision making process and PivotLink was the only SaaS BI vendor to with SAS 70 Type II certification. The IT group is enthusiastic about eliminating the report backlog and putting analytic capabilities into the hands of business users across the organization. They are even evaluating the possibility of expanding it to be used by other departments.

Furthermore
column49:

Getting visibility into our business in ways that weren’t possible before with on-premise BI or Excel spreadsheets is imperative in this business climate. PivotLink is robust

column7: 'review_title': 'Complete 360degree Chatter Governance! - Collaboration with piece of mind.'
column8: 'review_description': 'We were looking to make our Chatter environment safe and more secure so that we never have any major compliance problems. On looking further on Appexhchange
column9: our Sales force Admin. found few technical blacklist tools here and there but we could not find anything as complete and business policy driven as Secure Chatter. This tool covers the entire gamut of Chatter Governance from Prevention
column12: Continuous Monitoring and Archiving. Our team loves the ease of use and especially the Enforcer user type which allows us to distribute the Chatter Governance controls and policies amongst business units who own several Chatter Groups. This is a compliance tool created by business users for business users and is not some technical whiz-bang tool just for the IT admin. We thank Secure Chatter for getting the Auditors from giving us sleepless nights in IT.'}
column19: 'review_title': 'Secure Chatter is the final stop for our Healthcare and Pharma Compliance needs for Chatter'
column20: 'review_description': 'We are in a regulated industry with many FDA and other SEC as well as legal compliance and risk management mandates. In our IT rollout planning Chatter is a key component of our Sales and growth strategy and we have over thousand employees and expanding with Chatter being centerpiece collaboration tool. While our CEO and Sales group are really pushing for growth and collaboration by adopting Chatter
column21: our Internal Audit and Legal department though have raised many red flags for compliance and governance in our use of Chatter. On working with Confident Governance we have been able to use their Secure Chatter products which has saved us literally hundreds of hours in compliance detective work and has enabled us to keep rolling out Chatter. Our Internal Audit group loved the fact that it has a Audit Report component in its Detect functionality. Our legal group loves the fact that it has Prevent components to proactively prevent compliance gaps from happening as well as Data can be safely archived based on the legal needs. The company behind SecChat is a Compliance expert and when we had business and functional issues to discuss with audit and legal group they helped us in the IT team cover all the basis. For Healthcare and regulated industries I highly recommend Secure Chatter.'}
column28: 'review_title': 'secure chatter - be informed all the time.'
column29: 'review_description': 'We find Chatter most useful when it comes to collaborating among other team members when we’re working on a big proposal. It makes collaboration easier and we get instant updates. It basically improves quality of work and keeps everyone equally informed.'}
column37: 'review_description': 'We started using this tool for our Chatter admins and soon realized that it can do much more than just Secure and Govern Chatter. We used the functionality called Chatter Enforcer to create policies and then enforce these in our user groups where Chatter Enforcers can actually track and monitor their users while controlling the ability for what and how a user posts or read. This saved us lot of trouble in dealing with our Legal Compliance folks. They were impressed that IT thought through this before the. This piece of mind came at next to nothing in cost per user and now we can scale with Chatter without worries. Confident Governance is the way we will go for Salesforce Security and Governance needs.'}
column44: 'review_title': 'Transforming the way companies are connecting with their customers
column46: 'review_description': "Secure “SMART“ Chatter brings the word 'Secure' to social. We are on the way to evaluating Chatter and the Communities' features for future and this product has helped us convince our CIO why Salesforce.com Chatter is a lifesaver.The features for Preventing

column8: 'review_description': 'I really liked this app at first. In our Org we handle projects in an assembly line sort of way and have several tasks involved in one project. I couldn't imagine my business without this app..."}
column161: Great app...especially if you are a PE Customer'
column162: 'review_description': 'This app was one of the most turnkey applications I experienced. The setup guide and user guide are easy to follow. And a HUGE
column163: HUGE win is that if you are a Professional Edition customer
column164: this has automated-tasking (i.e. Action Plans)! You cannot use the Action Plan app if you are PE customer. This is a great replacement. The consolidated Task interface is much more attractive than the native interface for Task Management. One caveat: I wish it worked with Leads
column165: but I imagine that is coming.'}
column173: 'review_description': 'I was really pleased with several of the features of the DONE! product that enhanced collaboration for tasks while utilizing the existing SFDC Task object so we would also be able to keep utilizing our existing Chatter Feed Tracking. The tool also allowed users to add individuals to be "informed" and notified of task updates without them having to search for the task via reporting
column174:
then follow it. The ability to "Discover" tasks that had not even been created so that we could be notified was even more exciting!

I would also mention that the team at DONE! was extremely interested in any suggestions we had for product enhancement. They even made an enhancement change to the product based on feedback we supplied while we were review the app!

We tested two other AppExchange apps to help with task notifications and visibility and found the DONE tool to be the best fit for our organizations needs.'}

column192: 'review_title': 'Automates a repeatable business process - just what I needed'
column193: 'review_description': "I repeat the same marketing steps in my business model and was looking for a way to take a new business opportunity and apply a series of follow up steps automatically which would then prompt me to complete those steps at the appointed time in the future. I searched and searched the app exchange and finally found this gem of an app. The flexibility is incredible through the Task Templates feature
column194: and it even can be set up so that sequential steps get placed on hold if the preceding step is delayed for some reason. Features like that showed me early on how well-thought-out the app has turned out to be. A huge plus (and an unexpected one) was their very high level of customer support. I had questions along with a couple of feature suggestions and all of my interactions with the makers of 'Done' have blown me away with their personal level of care and overall help with my implementation. This app by itself makes the entirety of Salesforce worth it for me. Exceptionally well done."}

column61: 'review_description': 'We have been implementing this TMS for 6 months. My finances are still not bi-lateral and there are errors that have impacted my cash flow and receivables. For example. there is a one to one ratio for shipment and an invoice. the system cannot manage multiple vendors (insurance
column63: rigging etc) the system matched a VENDOR invoice to a shipment and not the vendor name or vendor id. When this transfers to QBB you lose the load number association to the vendor. Its a real mess and one that they "over sold" in terms of capability. There is no training manual
column64: there is no preliminary user set up or documentation for programming. Its basically it breaks
column65: they fix it. We use QBB as our finance system which should be an easy integration. I will tell you it takes about 60 clicks of your mouse to process one invoice through their TMS to ready it for transfer. The back office process is horrible and a definite time suck on the business. Operationally there are benefits to platform
column66: but the back office carrier vetting
column68: ZED integration for finance is HORRIBLE. they should just stick to an IIF file for QBB. I am looking for alternate solutions. Maybe in a couple of years their platform will be ready with a professional managed implementation team. CEO has been unavailable for support.'}

completed or on hold. Project overview with built in gant chart makes checking on the status of milestones and actions as simple as scrolling down the page with colours for every stage of the project its easy to see what done and needs doing.

A great easy ti use app that won't blow the budget!*****"}]

column47:
'review_description': "We've been running Matrix fully since 04/16.

Matrix has allowed our company to streamline the workflow between sales and fulfillment.

We're able to apply actual shipping rates at the order level and collect payment before the order enters fulfillment.

The fulfillment process has also been improved by utilizing the standard workflow developed in Matrix.

With Matrix
column48:
we now process over 90% of our business completely through Salesforce.

Prior to Matrix
column49:
most of these processes were very manual and inefficient.

The last point I'd like to make is that I have been acting as our company's SF Admin. I have zero formal training and absolutely no IT background.

The entire team at Matrix has been more helpful than expected! Every email
column51:
or text is responded to! Every issue is identified and worked out.

The support is always there when needed so I have confidence that our Matrix/Salesforce combo is only going to improve and we get better at maximizing it's potential.

We absolutely recommend this program for any business looking for similar solutions."}
column58: 'review_title': 'Top Notch Service - Helped us streamline our operations and order fulfillment'
column59: 'review_description': 'I can’t say enough good things about Matrix particularly in terms of their support. We have been using them for a little over 1 year but have been using Salesforce for almost 3 years. Matrix provided us with the native tool to manage our web orders
column60: inventory tracking and shipping. Our install was fairly complex because we were already a salesforce user with a highly customized interface. I have almost 300 workflow rules and process flows that we needed to test to ensure nothing would break in the migration. If I recall
column61:
Matrix’s typical install timeframe is 1-2 weeks? Because of our unique environment the Matrix team had to work around the clock over a weekend to do the install. I believe this was on a holiday weekend (4th of July) as well. They came through and got it done. They kept me informed at each stage of the install and were very thorough in explaining what was happening.

We did have one issue with inventory tracking but after troubleshooting with the Matrix team we discovered it was because we were using the system incorrectly. They are very thorough in their tech support and go above and beyond what I’ve experienced from most application providers in Salesforce.

If it helps to understand our scale we ship about 200 orders daily. When I have had suggestions for ways to improve the application Matrix has been very responsive and pretty quickly rolls out new functionality to address what I need.'}
column69: 'review_description': "Steve was great. The platform wouldn't work for our complicated inventory but it wasn't for lack of trying or communication on their part."}
column77: 'review_description': 'Matrix Velocity is an excellent addition to Salesforce for us. it has helped us to more accurately track our inventory. column85:
'review_description': 'We needed a way to go from quote --> order --> fulfillment --> invoice (and manage inventory) all within Salesforce. Matrix met this need nicely.

The Matrix team has also been great to work with.'}

column132: 'review_description': 'We’ve been using Matrix for almost a year and I have nothing but great things to say about the application and the entire Matrix team. We’ve been so pleased with the entire process that we’ve recently had more custom work done to further automate our workflow. Great value!'}]

column117: 'review_description': "We just finished an extensive trial of the product
column118: and I agree with what others have said

column122:
you can automate a series of emails to match it.

The deal killer for us
column123: and the reason we didn't convert into paying clients
column124: is because we employ Person Accounts within salesforce
column125: which are super common in B2C sales environments
column126: and are sort of a hybrid between a contact and a standard business account. The Makesbridge system only supports emails to Contacts and Leads. Makesbridge doesn't support custom objects
column127: nor person accounts. When I sync up my person accounts lists with Makesbridge
column129: but it doesn't recognize or import any of the fields that are Person Account specific
column130: so you're unable to base any automation rules off of those fields. I was super disappointed about that. If they ever build in the ability to support Person Accounts
column132:
I'll be first in line to sign up.

All that said
column133: I have to give the app 5 stars because it's amazing for what it's built for
column135: I just really wish they can expand the offering a little more so that it will work for our use case. Thank you to the team at Makesbridge for being incredibly helpful and surprisingly nice to work with. If you need to automate email campaigns to Leads or Contacts

PSA is an okay product that we are finding useful. Usually. Until there is an issue. Support is miserable to deal with. They will agree to anything and then not follow through. (daily calls for updates) They will feed you a line of whatever they think you will bite on to push you off. Have been working on a problem for 5 months and the Product Manager nor Development Manager will take or return a call after many requests. If you can't support this yourself I would say stay away."}

column28:
'review_description': "We've been using PSA for a full year and have been driving value from it right across our global business since. Our teams are based in right across the world and this tool enables us to share work assignments out based on skill levels and availability without having to wait for individuals to tell us when they can work.
Reporting has also been absolutely transformed. Monthly reports which used to take 2-3 days to produce each month can now be run in a matter of seconds
column29:
and the visibility of the team utilisation I am far better able to maintain a health budget.
Having the PSA Community on the FF website is also really helpful with other users helping you out and giving advice on best practice.
Like with most things
column30: you get out what you put in. If you really invest the time and effort in using the platform
column31: the benefits are there to take."}
column38: 'review_title': 'Still Assess as we complete our World -wide roll-out ( 3.5 stars )'
column39: 'review_description': "We just completed our FF PSA roll-out moving all our consultants from one application to this one. We have overcome a lot of hurdles to get to this point. FF’s partner CLD have been extremely helpful in getting us here. We have learned some hard lessons (like don't become an early adopter
column40:
update to new FF version while doing a major launch).
We are beginning to see (and hear) some of the business benefit we had hoped for. However
column41:
this is a huge change management effort for our consultants as they are going from multiple non connected systems that had more slack to a single system with validations prevent manipulation unless you have the correct access rights. So some users appreciate this while others struggle with seeing the forest beyond the trees.

Continued improvements in the areas of timecard UI and Planners (resource and project) will further add to greater user appreciation as currently there are some fundamental requirements that we need implementing. In some instances
column42: where we have had to create our own customization
column43: not ideal as we would prefer to us OOB as much as possible
column44:
mainly because our clients can’t wait based on the FF timetable

The support case process / workflow I think could be improved based on experience with some other online support ticket models. With that said the Support from the FF team has been good and we have definitely tested them during our major milestone launches and critical fiscal closure periods over the past year.

They have shown patience as we progress; particularly our CSM @Kathleen Rouse as well as interactions with @Mike Seto
column45: our account mgr. and these support people @Jessica Wu and @ Lisa Gedryn but not limited to just them as I can't name them all."}

column715: 'review_description': "Both PSA & FFA have help facilitate and underpin IRM's business transformation programme. We have been using Financial Force for over two years now and it increasingly supports more areas of our business as we develop the applications further. The key benefit to us have been the standardisation of our end to end processes from creating the original sales opportunity in SalesForce through managing the project through to billing and being paid by our customers. We have derived numerous benefits over the journey the key ones being visibility of where the business is at any point in time and improving our invoicing cycle by over 2 weeks. We have also successfully developed real time dashboard reporting and the integration of the project assignments with Microsoft exchange. During our two year journey FinancialForce has also facilitated the integration of two foreign subsidiaries and a completely new business stream. column39:
and exporting data via the Excel add-in to do things that SF can't handle.

This is a great value
column40:
you are getting your data loaded into an Oracle database which gives you full flexibility to carve it up any way you can think of.

In response to the other reviews
column41:
this product is not like SF reports (or video game) - you can't just start playing around with it and figure out how all of the advanced reporting works. The price of this app includes support and you'll be needing your rep to help set everything up correctly. My rep has done an excellent job and has been able to answer all the questions I've had.

column52: 'review_description': 'OEM has been searching for a project management tool that is detailed enough to actually be of some help when planning complex multi department projects while still offering an interface for ownership that lets them have a "fly by" look at the projects progress. column55: but Avata released several product updates based on our needs which means we are able to use a product that works for the way we do business

it would be nice if the tool could be used on previously-created cases. It only works on cases created after installation.

column257:
'review_description': "This was just what I needed for our helpdesk. I want to keep track of how long it takes our helpdesk consultants to answer and resolve cases.

Previously
column258:
we had to rely on total time the case stayed open. This isn't accurate because we have clients who disappear on us for days or more.

With this application
column259:
you can assign case statuses to either time with customer or time with support. I now monitor total time with support for helpdesk cases and it is so much more accurate. I now know who really deserves the praise and who requires training.

One little suggestion though
column260: it would be very useful if we had other 'time with' options."}

column7: 'review_title': 'Transition to ECM has been very positive'
column8: 'review_description': 'We transitioned to ECM after using a legacy client information system for over 10 years. The transition was remarkably smooth. Users found the tool intuitive and easy to use

column19: 'review_description': 'Working with Exponent Partners was a great experience for our organization. We went from an old system that users were frustrated with
column21: Exponent Case Management. Now our users are excited to be working in Salesforce and ECM. Everyone we worked with at Exponent partners was helpful
column22: empathetic to the major changes we were implementing
column24: and very invested in learning about our programs in order to build us the best system possible. I appreciated the Exponent Partners team taking the time to learn about our work
column25: which helped us to have a great implementation.'}
column32: 'review_title': 'Connecting all of our programmatic efforts through Eponent Case Management (ECM)'
column33: 'review_description': 'My agency was searching for a tool to let us coordinate and track our clients in one place. One of the biggest benefits we’ve seen from ECM is that we now have that one central place to put in all of our programs & services. It’s really valuable to view clients across multiple programs
column34: both in the past and in real time. We like that the out-of-the-box tool is already set up to map our basic business processes of intake
column37:
which would otherwise have to be created from scratch.

I think the client household model is helpful as well
column39: and Salesforce is not natively set up that way. Reporting has also become a lot more seamless for us. The framework is flexible enough to build other forms and features too
column40: and for some programs we’ve configured unique components like a housing tracker. It’s been great having the support of the team at Exponent Partners; they’re really responsive!'}
column47: 'review_title': 'An app developed with an understanding of nonprofit operations'
column48:
'review_description': 'In our annual IT satisfaction survey the user satisfaction with Exponent Case Management was about 92%. Most systems don’t have satisfaction that high.

It’s fantastic to have a system that covers over 25 of our programs
column49: and lets us report within and across programs. We can use the framework of ECM but customize it to each of our different services
column50: from health to family services to employment. That was a huge priority for us when selecting a new system. We didn’t want to be tied to something that we couldn’t
column52: manage ourselves. The system will never really be “done” – we continue to engage with staff to make it even more useful. Staff have come up with lots of ideas about new features and we can be very responsive. Small changes like a new field or a new option on a picklist can be made very quickly
column53: often within the day. Osborne was one of the first adopters of ECM
column54: so we were able to work with Exponent Partners as they were developing the system. We started implementation about 3 years ago and are using a version that pre-dates the current managed package
column55:
but the framework is the same.

The overall ease of use is much higher than with our old system. Entering group services is an area where users have had some difficulties
column56: so we’ve created more user documentation and training around that. Reporting is much simpler and staff are now using real-time
column57: custom dashboards. Direct service staff track their active caseloads and managers see real-time performance dashboards
column58: in ways that weren’t previously possible. The application has changed the way we work -- the assistance with our work process has been very helpful. Staff get reminders of deadlines
column60: or service follow-ups. They used to track those things in calendars or Excel or other ways that just created more work
column61: but now that kind of tracking is built into our solution. It’s part of why staff really see value in ECM as a tool to help them manage their work.'}]

column249: 'review_description': "Zuora Z-Force solved a very key need for us -- the AppExchange provides no built-in billing or checkout options for package publishers. It's also integrated with the License Management App so that payments are automatically associated to user count. column251: and you'd expect Salesforce to provide it. There is a lot of complexity that goes into billing though

column38:
for our organization it is missing some key features.

First
column39:
required fields. A survey is worthless if respondents can just skip over key questions that you really need answered.

Second
column40: the weighting of responses is nice
column41: but where can we see how many respondents selected any given answer? Even a percentage breakdown would be nice. My execs want to see "out of 100 respondents
column42:
30% said this and 70% said that".

Last thing that would be a big help is the ability to export the results for distribution to key stakeholders. (possibly it\'s there and I just missed it?)

Also
column43: I noticed that the system only allows a user to submit responses one time. When I tried to resubmit the form from the same link
column44:
the page reloaded but not error message or confirmation of submission. Better to tell the user what they are doing wrong or they can get really confused.

Don\'t get me wrong... most of this app is really well designed. It just needs to be a bit more robust to meet our needs. Keep up the good work
