column59:
'review_description': 'We have been using Charket for more than 6 months. I have tested all available Salesforce integrations with WeChat before deciding to go with Charket for the following reasons:
1) Best design both internally and externally
2) Live Chat feature and analytics reports are state of the art
3) Easy customisations through Process Builder
4) Most importantly
column60:
fast response from the team for enquiries and support

Charket app works with standard objects (leads
column62: accounts) however our org uses mainly custom objects. With the help from Charket team
column63:
we were able to do seemless customisations. Charket core team have very in-depth developer experience in Salesforce and WeChat.

Additionally
column65:
there are many new updates and features almost every month or bi-monthly. Throughout working with Charket Team I realised that they put in a lot of sustainable thinking and well thought out design to ensure that all new versions and customisations development can be upscaled easily and have the least negative impact.

Things that I have done with Charket:
1) Customized agent assignment routing (Our agents have different market allocation hence I will need to put the right leads to the right agent automatically)
2) Customized certain leads to go to specific agents and remaining leads to be distributed to agents base on least active chat and last time online.
3) Receive email and WeChat notification for chats that have not been read for X amount of time
4) Sync form records to other custom objects
5) Sync survey records to other custom objects
6) Use process builder to automatically push right WeChat contents at specific time. (e.g. after a form is filled in
column66:
I am able to send a WeChat article based on a specific value in the form. And I can use time triggers to send more content to do lead nurturing.)
7) WeChat Campaign feature
column67: I could follow up with leads that status have not changed and send mass message to these leads.'}

column275: 'review_description': "Charket is the only solution I could find that brings WeChat into the world of enterprise CRM by effectively bringing lead data into the world's leading CRM solution (Salesforce). Without a centralization of leads into a single system
column276:
large inside salesforces using WeChat for lead generation are left manually managing hundreds of contacts and WeChat groups - an inefficient and disorganized process.

Beyond just capturing leads in an organized way
column277: Charket has an additional key benefit: it allows us to track the ROI of our QR-code based marketing campaigns. Before Charket
column278: we would send QR codes out into the world and roughly guess how much impact they had. Now we can explicitly measure the number of scans for each code
column279:
and measure how many of the leads generated from those scans end up becoming real sales opportunities.

We are only at the beginning of our implementation with Charket and I see some great possibilities. Hope to write an updated review once we've fully deployed it.

If you are a small to medium sized US business in need of advice on using WeChat to sell in China and how Charket could help
column280:
I am open to talk. Please find me on LinkedIn

Michael Kehoe

column60: 'review_title': 'Good Product - Really Enhances Productivity - But Too Many Updates'
column61: 'review_description': "We have used CongaGrid (formerly ActionGrid) for several years. We incorporated it into multiple sales and operational processes. One example is weekly sales credit: we have filtered views where users can see all their Opportunities which have related submitted Orders for the past week
column62: and enter data on specific product categories for which they are claiming sales credit. A manager then has a separate view where they review the rep submissions for the week
column63: and either approve or disapprove the request. For approved ones
column64: the manager checks a box visible in the view
column65: to indicate these Opportunities are manager reviewed & approved. It takes something that would be highly manual
column66: requiring data entry on multiple pages
column67:
and turns it into something where we can do cross-object filtering and multi- or mass-data entry on relevant records.

The tool is incredibly flexible
column69: and allowing you to use data on linked records
column70: or to do complex filtering to present just the data that is relevant for the process in question. If you need a field to filter or edit
column72:
you can expose it and make it available to the user.

One issue we have had is with Conga's release cycle
column73:
where new functions and new look & feel are auto pushed to our organization. This has sometimes required a scramble for users to quickly learn the new considerations with the release as it is in production before they are aware of the changes.

Usage scenarios that we have implemented include:
Weekly sales credit claims/verification
Monthly compliance monitoring process
Timesheet entry using Activities
Operational master data clean up and enhancement processes
On-the-fly cross object reporting
Retention and new sales coaching and reporting

Overall
column74: this is a very useful tool that I would recommend to any administrator. Your more technically minded users will also find it to be invaluable."}

column149: 'review_description': "This is an absolute must-have for Salesforce
column150:
alongside the Inspector Chrome extension this should always be the first app you install in your Salesforce instance.

column151:
we use this tool EVERY SINGLE DAY.

My favorite use cases:

- Mass update records without Data Loader
column154:
modern interface (supports picklists and lookups nicely)
- Awesome cross-object functionality both for filtering and updating
- Easiest way to analyze root causes of bugs causing data problems
- Easily browse and edit data for 'hidden' or difficult to administer objects
- A great way to mass trigger workflow rules
column156: or flows in a one-off scenario (just create a temporary checkbox and mass update it using Grid to trigger the job(s)
column157:
then delete the field when you're done)
- The best Tech Support for any Salesforce App

The one thing I wish it could do is multiple page mass updates based on a formula (you can still update >1000 records at a time but not using a formula to produce the result currently)"}

column378: 'review_description': "ActionGrid is exactly what I was looking for. My users and I were getting frustrated with built in Salesforce functionality
column379: working with a combination of Reports and Views. Reports can't be edited
column380: and Views can only show fields from one object. It's also cumbersome to edit the data in Views
column381: and annoying to change their filter criteria as well. ActionGrid stepped in to save the day. With ActionGrid
column382: you can show data from any related object right next to the object you're looking at. It's super easy to edit a field. There's batch edit too
column383: and lots of cool features. For example
column384: you can export straight from a grid to Excel. No need to go create a report that looks like the view. You can fiter and unfilter
column387:
all on the fly.

One of my favorite things is that Grids can be embedded almost anywhere. You can put them on their own tabs
column388: with subtabs so for things you need to access together. You can also put them on any page view. For example
column390: I have a grid that shows me all the Opportunities that fall in that campaign
column391:
with subtabs for different Opportunity Stages.

Their Customer Support is second to none. They are always happy to jump on a call / gotomeeting and figure out exactly how to do what I need.

They are also always coming out with new features
column392:
and are very receptive to suggestions.

All in all

column1605: 'review_title': 'The ultimate tool for speedy in-line data-management
column1607: 'review_description': "We depend a lot on detailed notes and carefully filled out data fields for a variety of our reporting mechanisms to work. Entering fields one by one was cumbersome for our sales team
column1608: and created challenges for them when working on the go and needing to edit a variety of records for a particular report or reports. Oftentimes we found ourselves wishing there was a way to edit fields all at once on a list of records as if they were an excel spreadsheet. Salesforce in-line editing exists on some views
column1609:
but only for a few fields.

Enter ActionGrid.

Our outside consultants recommended the tool earlier this year; we haven't looked back.

ActionGrid allows you to:

-Create a grid for all child objects on a particular page layout
column1610: edit any field of that object
column1611: and quick save all changes all at once! You can also edit childs of those child records
column1612:
or other related records all from one small grid in the page layout using 'Reading Panes'.

-Create quick data management views and shortcuts to edit revenue forecasts
column1614:
and other important fields for an entire pipeline - all at once! No more opening 10-15 tabs to quickly update 1 field on a list of opportunities.

-Mass-fill and transfer records: you can quickly make the same change across a filtered list of records with just a couple clicks. Transfer owners
column1617: modify address information on all contacts for a company move
column1618:
and more!

-Use conditional formatting within views to point out specific records or areas: we use conditional formatting on 'Last Activity' on all of our contacts to highlight contacts that should be followed up with.

-Build
column1620: and export reports on the fly! You can interact with any report as an ActionGrid and export as soon as you've made your changes
column1621:
all in one screen.

-All fields supported: picklists
column1624:
etc.!

All around 100% A+. Would recommend to any sales team."}

column1695: 'review_title': "If you haven't looked at ActionGrid you are letting your users down"
column1696:
'review_description': 'We implement Salesforce and also act as the administrator for a number of our customers.
There are a number of "very special" apps that we insist on in most implementations.
We have recently added ActionGrid to that list.

Without exception
column1697:
ActionGrid has revolutionized and streamlined key processes for our customers who have begun using it. It does everything the other reviews have said AND MORE.

If you haven\'t already done so
column1698:
invest 45 minutes in one of Steve\'s introductory webcasts.
It was the most valuable 45 minutes I have spent in the last few months. Not just for myself but for our customers who have now begun using ActionGrid.

What makes it so special?
Like all new apps. There is a learning curve – but this one is measured in minutes not hours

Setup is also measured in minutes. Then you sit back and wait for the look of delight on the end users\' faces.

For many years we have talked about the "360° view of the customer". The challenge today is that there is now so much information and related information associated with any organisation\'s customers that end-users can easily get lost in the data available

With ActionGrid it is amazing how much information can be displayed in such an easily accessible and intuitive way on a single screen.

When you ask users what information they need to see they normally say something like "Everything
column1699: but I only want to see it when I need to see it
column1700:
so that I don\'t get confused.

ActionGrid\'s focus on the end user experience has achieved that.

From an administrator\'s point of view I am able to rapidly deliver functionality to the end-users that let\'s them work with even the most complex data structures in a very simple interface.
There are some limits to the amount of data that can be manipulated at any one time
column1701: but for the day-to-day users that has not been an issue. And as an administrator I have other tools that I use in conjunction with ActionGrid if ever l strike those limits'}

column1864:
my original review was when the app was Action Grid. The app is now owned by Conga and rebranded Conga Grid.

This product is NOT lightning ready as it claims. The only lightning feature available is to provide the option for your grid to have a "Lightning Look"
column1865:
but you cannot actually setup buttons to use the grid with various objects.

The Browse feature is no longer supported and that function was used by our team extensively. It was only after I requested help because it wasn\'t working that I was informed that Conga will no longer support it as the app did when it was Action Grid. We had to purchase another product and pay for custom development to be able to browse multiple records from a grid view.

Support for the grid product is not very good. We began using the product when it was Action Grid and there is an obvious change in product knowledge and support since being purchased by Conga. Conga doesn\'t provide support for custom actions at all for this product
column1866: and it is difficult to find knowledgeable help when you encounter a real problem. You have to go through a series of submitting a support case
column1867: scheduling a screen share to show your problem to someone
column1868:
then that person takes the problem higher up and gets back to you (sometimes). It\'s truly disappointing.

The base product still works okay in Classic (allowing 2 stars)
column1869:
that is viewing multiple records in a grid format and doing mass updates.

Considering all SF users will need to eventually transition to lightning
column1870: I would not recommend this product.'}

column1957: 'review_description': "We were in the market for a solution that would enable our team to get an excel spreadsheet-like user interface in Salesforce. We tested many alternatives to ActionGrid
column1958: including Gridbuddy and many others. ActionGrid won hands-down for a few reasons: the App was designed with business users in mind

column1963: pushing frequent updates and bug fixes
column1964:
and i value that. The App works in Professional edition and does not require API.

Issues: We run into performance issues which they helped us address in collaboration with the SF support staff. They also made adjustments to a few UI issues along the way. The performance is now adequate.

Area for improvement: i wish one wouldn't have to be in edit mode to do in-line editing (Gridbuddy is good for that).

Overall

column47: 'review_title': 'Adoption Data Does not Populate in the Analytics App!'
column48: 'review_description': 'After working with Salesforce support over the course of about a month
column49: there was a Known Issue Article created w/ no current workaround. The app does not populate with any of the adoption data due to this issue so it is currently useless. Here is a link to the Known Issue: https://success.salesforce.com/issues_view?Id=a1p3A000000AU2N'}
column56: 'review_title': 'What can you do with this package !'
column57: 'review_description': 'If you are tracking analytics adoption you know that log lines do not store user inputted information ( aka lens names
column59:
app names) ! Analytics asset ids and labels need to be extracted and uploaded as a dataset and then augmented with log data to gain meaningful insights.

Use this package to
1. Create a dataset with Analytics asset IDs and labels.
2. Create a custom object (analyticsadopt__DatasetDetails__c)with dataset metadata that links datasets to lenses
column61:
and apps and provides a count of rows.
3. Schedule updates to the dataset and custom object using a custom Visualforce page.'}]

column170: when I was searching for a Survey tool. It's FREE and so easy to install
column171:
with the step by step instructions guide.
Our goal was to survey internal users
column172: not customers and this fit the bill for both Post-training and Post-implementation scenarios. Once the un-managed package is installed
column173:
our business stakeholders can build the survey themselves then create their own questions and easily send it out in Chatter or email.

FYI - needed but didn't come with the package is one Custom Report: Surveys -> with Surveys Taken -> with Survey Question Responses and need two custom summary fields:
1. 'COUNT of Responses' on Survey Taken
2. 'SUM of Responses' field on Survey.
Together
column174: these fields will give you the actual answers on your reports
column176:
Response 002).
Tip: Create a report for each of the questions (works best if 1 department is using 1 survey)
column178:
where each component will be representing each question

column364: 'review_title': 'Image not Visible Error on Header when the Rich text Area is edited'
column365:
'review_description': 'The app allows for uploading an image from file explorer and appends that image to the Survey header section. User can re-select a different image later.

column366:
an error is seen:

"Image Not Available .This image is not available because:
*You don’t have the privileges to see it
column367:
OR
*It has been removed from the system."

One has to remove the image completely and re-attach to see it correctly again.

A component "LexInputField.component”
column368:
is coded to render the image as a Rich text area field.
Component\'s code snippet is as below:
<!-- Render Textarea Field -->
<apex:outputPanel layout="block" styleClass="slds-form-element" id="divTextArea" rendered="{!isTextarea}">
<label class="slds-form-element__label" for="txtArea">{!$ObjectType[objectName].Fields[field].Label}</label>
<div class="slds-form-element__control">
<apex:inputField id="txtArea" value="{!sObject[field]}" styleclass="slds-textarea"></apex:inputField>
</div>
</apex:outputPanel>

Could you please help us resolve this issue?'}

column614:
commented out the choices__c field (so I could change field type).

all fine (question 3 now was accepted)

2) I would like to dataload questions and answers using Apex Data loader but in trying to figure out field formating in Dev Console

column784: 'review_description': 'I have used Survey Force for doing an internal survey
column785: and it turned out pretty good. So.. here is the thing. It is a free offering right... And not a dedicated enterprise survey platform. So
column786: one should be clear on expectations while setting out to use Survey Force. It is your free offering for doing simplistic surveys
column787: without spending a penny. In that context
column788: this application works brilliantly. But if you were to start bench marking this against full-blown enterprise survey platforms like SurveyMonky or ClickTools (all for which you have to pay a premium for)
column789: it falls apart. Survey Force gives you the basic ability to administer a simple survey from within Salesforce
column790: and run reports on the response. If that is all what you need

column883: 'review_description': 'If you are looking for a low-cost (FREE) survey tool and don\'t need a lot of bells and whistles then this is the right package. I have now installed Survey Force at my third client site and find it
column887: and usable product. In my 3 installs I have run the gamut from detailed (10+questions) Customer satisfaction survey to minimal question NPS (Net Promoter Score) Surveys. Survey Force
column888:
with a little add on code has been able to provide viable solutions at every site.

A few things to make life easier:
a) Provide a "Clone" option. For example at the current client they needed the survey\'s brand based so I had to recreate the initial survey 10 times and change 2 words on 1 question to succeed for each survey.
b) Provide capability to add dynamic data to questions (i.e. - allow me to embed a object & field) similar to email templates.'}

column1248: 'review_title': 'The report that brought down an App'
column1250:
Take a look at Apex Class: SurveyAndQuestionController
Do you mind explaining why you hardcoded on line 68:

reportId = rfu.findReportId('Survey with Questions and Responses');

If someone modifies that Report name here's what breaks:

'Survey' Tab - No longer works
column1251:
100% application failure.
System QueryException: List has no rows for assignment to SObject.

What's more
column1252:
Inbound ChangeSets on any object fail due to that chunk of code going down to 22% coverage.

From a code review perspective
column1253:
im surprised this was even put out. That little bit right there trashed the entire App.

Fix this.

I wont even get started on your Documentation
column1254: I'm sure enough people have torn into you over the complete lack of clarity and misinformation. IF anyone is lucky enough to get this App working
column1255: be sure to lock down that report against any form of editing."}

column1427: 'review_title': 'ERROR: Invalid Survey or Contact ID / HEADER-THANK YOU PAGE - SOLUTION'
column1428: 'review_description': '1. Create a Public Group (Setup-> Administration Setup -> Manage Users -> Public Groups) with the name "Survey" with the "Site Invited User" as a member (the new user that its created when you create the site for the survey). Then create a read only sharing rule (Setup-> Administration Setup-> Secutiry Controls-> Sharing Settings) on Accounts object
column1429:
from "All Internal Users" with that newly created Public Group.

2. Then create a read only sharing rule (Setup-> Administration Setup-> Secutiry Controls-> Sharing Settings) on Contacts object
column1430:
from "All Internal Users" with that newly created Public Group.

3. If having any issue to see the Header and Thank You page for external users
column1431: there is something missing. Go to "Your Name-> Setup-> App Setup-> Develop-> Sites" then click on your Surveys Site URL
column1432:
then press the button "Public Access Settings" and modify your Public Guest Profile by giving it "Read Access" to every single field of the Survey__c object.

4. Cheers'}

column8: Support could be improved'
column9: 'review_description': 'After years of struggling on Family Metrics
column10: our organization finally switched over to CIRCE to track our Residents and their Service needs. On the whole

column14: we had made a number of requests for minor additions/customizations to be made to the CIRCE package that we felt were necessary for our work; unfortunately those changes were not (and still have not) been implemented. As such

column27: 'review_title': 'HIPAA Compliant • Massive Productivity Leap • Easy to Adopt'
column28:
'review_description': 'The Circe application has proven to be an indispensable productivity addition for our Care Management Services team with the Laguna Beach Seniors. It has enabled us to be more efficient and effective while staying HIPAA compliant.

Circe was easy to adopt because it follows the logical flow of capturing demographic information starting first with the Client Chart
column29: then creating Program Charts for each of our programs
column30: which in turn tracks and documents each client’s progress notes as a Service
column31: which enables our care managers to quickly see chart history and relevant recent activity. All extraneous documents pertaining to each client can also be uploaded and accessed from the Program Chart
column32:
reducing the risk of lost files and client data.

The flexibility of Circe has allowed us to customize the application specific to our organizational needs and provides us with relevant
column33: meaningful reports. And with the Circe application implemented
column34: our organization has been able to go paperless! Not only can we access records when in the field; it also allows Care Managers to assist clients more efficiently when the assigned care manager is unavailable
column35:
ensuring continuity of care.

Another nice feature is the forgiving nature of the CIRCE application
column36:
which allows us to quickly find and fix data input errors all while keeping record of the edit for compliance.

In short
column37: this Care Management System makes us more efficient and reliable as well as HIPAA compliant
column38:
mobile and paperless. And it was significantly more affordable when compared to the other Salesforce options.

We couldn’t be more thrilled.'}

the average time between the time a service was provided and the time it was documented went from 49 days to 24 hours.

There is no way we could maintain compliance without Circe. Now
column77:
and which aren’t.

Circe transformed the way we work with our clients.'}]

column36: 'review_description': "The implementation and connection to Salesforce was quick and easy. InsightSquared does a lot of great things that I personally haven't seen other analytics companies do. The product has opened our eyes and real helped us to better understand our pipeline and bookings. One of the biggest difference makers and something that we were never able to track previous to implementing InsightSquared was tracking pipeline history
column37:
being able to see a detailed view of how our pipeline and deals change over time is excellent. It is very intuitive and easy to use and navigate. There are many reports already created in the system that are beneficial so once you are up and running you already of many reports created for you to use and analyze at your disposal. Dashboards are easy to create and many templates readily available to make it even easier. There's much to like about this product and company.

Customization and custom reports have been the only challenge for our business. Outside of their pre-built reports
column38: custom reports are very limited and if your business has a unique way of looking at certain data points or you have a report that is more advanced looking at multiple pieces of data you may have a hard time implementing these into Insightsquared. That being said their support and customer happiness team are available for calls and discussions to help get you what you need. I also wish there was a little more flexibility in being able to change the sizes of graphs in the dashboard as you only have one size to use currently. I would like to have some more prominent graphs or graphs with more data show up larger than others
column39: but this has not been a huge problem."}

column447: 'review_description': "We were looking for a better reporting package for Salesforce and we were connected to Insight Squared via a recommendation from a colleague. It didn't take long to figure out that the reporting they can provide isn't easily possible in Salesforce and to do it would cost you $250k to $500k in time and effort that could be spent elsewhere on your business. You can see trends by rep for pipeline and closed deals. You can see trends by custom fields like industry category as well. Their monthly and quarterly forecasting works very well and is a good view of your future potential. Installation is a snap. They send you an email
column449: then a day later your account is provisioned. Nothing could be easier. Finally
column450: it is cost effective. They only bill you for the user licenses that put data into the system. So if you have 20 sellers carrying a book
column451: you pay for 20 licenses. You need to have access for 50 people? No problem
column453: you pay for contributing sellers. It is a great plan and makes a lot of sense. I can't recommend this product enough."}

column8: Good Interface - Horrible Test issues with Unmanaged version'
column9: 'review_description': "This is a good app. If you're not going to modify it or build off it - go download the managed version! The unmanaged version has many test failures. There are two Classes
column10: one passes 21 out 50 unit tests. The second class fails all 23 Unit tests. I'm really glad there's so many tests
column11:
I am disappointed all the system.asserts fail on those tests.

This makes the unmanaged package not worth installing unless you're planning on doing a lot of modification to the tests and the product. It's a great idea. The actual functionality works well. So if you don't need the modifications go download the managed version! https://appexchange.salesforce.com/listingDetail?listingId=a0N30000003IX0UEAW"}
column19: 'review_description': 'I installed this app. All functions works perfect. But it fails all tests. I cannot deploy other APEX class because classes from this APP are failing. Does anyone have same problem?'}

than the batch apex queue was backed up and missed a day
global String sObjectQuery =\'Select Id

objectName__c FROM chttrunfollow__UnfollowQueue__c WHERE scheduledUnfollowDate__c<= TODAY\' ;

and we build service and support applications on top of the platform. So the caliber of code heads is very high. When a user hit the follow limit I over heard just have \'Steve\' "do an execute anonymous to remove old records" for the user.

only looks at the those leads which are created beyond the rule created date.

column8: 'review_description': "I have deployed iATS for several clients and have been very pleased with the system. The installation has gotten a lot easier over the last couple of years
column9: and they've expanded the options for identifying existing contacts in Salesforce. No system can identify every possible duplicate
column10: but I have found that iATS does a very reasonable job matching new donations to existing contacts. They also provide over a dozen pre-defined templates as well as letting you define your own CSS to get the look & feel that you want. The system can also send out donation confirmations and failures which can be very helpful. I tend to leverage custom templates and workflows in Salesforce for successful transactions
column11: but definitely leverage iATS automated notifications if there are errors. I will continue to recommend this product to my clients."}
column19: 'review_description': 'With some trial and error to get things running and a bit of assistance from patient customer service folk at iATS
column20: my org has gotten this tool up working for us. Initially
column21:
we were looking for an online payment portal to replace the one we had been using. Our previous payment system did not integrate with Salesforce and we were unable to embed their payment form on our website.

column25: helping us keep better track of how we are raising funds. Additionally

column34: 'review_description': "I'm the data administrator for a large non-profit - we implemented iATS Aura and Brickwork as part of our migration to Salesforce about a year ago. Anytime I've run into something that isn't covered in the iATS guides

column54: 'review_title': 'Excellent payment app; sync to SF works great!'
column55: 'review_description': "I have installed this package at several of my clients and everyone is very pleased with it. The installation is a bit tedious with all the page layout updates

column59: with the ability to apply your own CSS to the forms. I highly recommend this product!"}

column67: 'review_description': 'iATS Payments has been great to work with as we moved from an old donor management system to Salesforce NPSP. iATS worked closely with our integration partner to correctly set up our monthly recurring donation program and migrate data from our old system. column68: the customer service team at iATS Payments provides outstanding support and troubleshooting to resolve the problems. I would highly recommend iATS Payments to anyone that is looking for a payment processor and is using Salesforce NPSP.'}

we have become familiar with most of the online giving tools out there. iATS Brickwork and Aura receive 5 stars for the following reasons:

* The customer service. As others have mentioned

it is exceptional.

The iATS team really "gets it" - they know their clients and they understand the space.'}
column105: 'review_description': 'We have a complex salesforce instance with many integrations and customizations so it can be challenging to troubleshoot issues. We process hundreds

of credit card transactions per day so it’s great to have a credit card processing system that is consistently up and running and is easy to use. I never have to worry about issues with credit card processing thanks to iATS!

column179: 'review_description': 'We use to have the Network for Good Donate Now button. However
column180:
the cost went from $19.95/month to $29.95/month to $59.95/month and that is when we searched for an alternative donation button for our nonprofit organization.

I have to be honest that I had our webdesigner to work on the application and to have it integrate with Salesforce
column181:
so I cannot tell you how easy it was or was not. But the results are fantastic. And what is even more is that our bank receive the donation directly instead of waiting for a check at the end of the month which is what Network for Good offered.

There are just some minor things that we are still trying to figure out
column182: but I chance that we have not taken the full time to read the entire information. The few times we had to contact IATS customer service
column191: 'review_description': "With the addition of support for card swipe readers and adding Campaign and Record Type IDs to the parameters for AURA setup in the latest release
column192: IATS BRICKWORK is maturing into an indispensable tool for nonprofits that have to process credit cards. I have just worked with an organization that used the BRICKWORK integration with Groundwire's Auctions for Salesforce package to manage payments for their annual fundraiser auction. We validated guests' credit cards as they arrived at the event
column193: using the CheckIn tab in GW Auctions and charged some of the cards as requested by guests at the end of the evening with the Check Out tab. It all worked seamlessly for the processing
column194:
and having card swipe readers saved a lot of time and effort.

I appreciate the elegance and flexibility of the IATS solution for Salesforce. An IATS Transaction record can be related to a Contact
column196: which gives the full range of options for creating the payment. For example
column199: so was related to the Contact only. But we have also used IATS for recurring donations
column200: where the original pledge is the Opportunity record
column201:
and each installment is represented by a related Transaction. The overnight Journal Sync is another excellent feature - pulling the recurring payments from the IATS servers and adding them to the Opportunity record without any extra effort from us.

IATS Customer Support is also responsive and friendly - I've enjoyed working with their team to solve problems and to get the additional features added when they are needed. Thanks to the IATS team for listening to what we ask for :-)

Caroline Renard
Technology Interpreter for Arts Groups"}
column208: 'review_title': 'Successful Event using payment processor BRICKWORK (IATS) with Auctions for Salesforce'

'review_description': 'We recently used BRICKWORK from within Auctions for Salesforce to process Auction Purchases. BRICKWORK is completely integrated with the Auctions app and was surprisingly easy and clean to use. Our only problems were due to user errors resulting from very little time to train the data entry volunteers (not the fault of the apps used). BRICKWORK is also more cost-effective than other options we have used or considered.

With the Auction fundraiser behind us we are learning of the other ways to use BRICKWORK for processing donations
column211:
both single and recurring donations. This is a great option for nonprofits using Salesforce!

pleasant and effective.

Highly recommended.



Jane Piston
Volunteer System Administrator
Women and Children´s Free Restaurant
Spokane
column222: 'review_description': 'Our Community House of Hope is a fledgling non-profit organization that needed to track about 500 initial donors; we also wanted online Credit Card donations with recurring and ACH payment options. We anticipate our donor list to grow 10 and 100 fold in the next few years. Similar organizations to us shared nightmarish experiences with their Merchant Account Services
column223:
“Donor Software” and EXCEL tracking. We considered using some consulting firms but they were too expensive and didn’t provide the flexibility we needed.

IATS Merchant Services
column224:
their Aura software and Brickwork allowed us to add a powerful application to our Non Profit Sales Force package. All at no cost and easy to follow installation instructions! IATS’ customer support was exceptional. We did encounter some recurring payment problems but they were addressed and fixed in a reasonable time. IATS support followed up on phone calls and it was a pleasure working with them. Our accounting team had no problems reconciling online donations through IATS and Sales Force reports. All of our support communications were with one or two knowledgeable people through IATS and we did not have to call around.

IATS was receptive to personal format preferences and included several suggestions in recent Brickwork software updates. Updates were handled by IATS and Brickwork professionals. Sales Force for Non Profit
column225:
IATS and Brickwork applications have been a good experience for us and we would highly recommend them to anyone considering tracking donors for non-profit.

Peter Wolf
column236: 'review_description': "IATS Brickwork has been incredible for our organization. We are a small non-profit in the first years of operation
column237: and IATS has been key in increasing our fundraising efficiency & effectiveness
column238: so we can keep our focus on programs instead of on administrative overhead. The IATS Brickwork application provides seamless integration with Salesforce
column239:
pushing all of the content captured on the AURA donation page directly into our Salesforce account.

Before using IATS
column241: which had higher transaction fees and did not offer us a customized donation page. We were inputting the data from Paypal manually into Salesforce
column242: and also had to manually transfer our funds from our Paypal account into our bank account. Now
column244: the data is automatically entered into Salesforce when a donation comes through (saving so much time on data entry)
column245:
and the online donations are deposited directly into our bank account.

IATS customer support and service has been excellent-- incredibly responsive and helpful. It has always been easy to reach a knowledgeable employee
column246: who is there to guide you through your questions
column247: and troubleshoot as needed. We recently ran a Mothers' Day fundraising campaign
column248: and IATS Brickwork was essential in the incredible success of the campaign
column249: and our team's ability to respond effectively to the over 1
column250: 900 donations we received in the span of three days. The AURA donation page encouraged these donations
column251: and we were able to raise 14x more in donations than we were expecting. All in all
column252:
everyone we've worked with at IATS has provided outstanding customer support.

They are currently working on developing an automated email message/receipt for donations
column253: which will be an added improvement on an already great application."}
column261: 'review_description': "We are in love with IATS! This is one of those products that you don't even realize how much you need
column262:
until you find out it exists. Excellent integration with Salesforce. Cost-effective web-based donations processing. Reduced time spent duplicating data entry.

We were experiencing several challenges. First
column263: processing credit card donations was a time-consuming process
column264: involving a lot of repeated data entry. We now process credit cards directly in Salesforce
column265:
which has completely streamlined the process. This has enabled us to cancel our merchant services account with our bank and rely solely on IATS for credit card processing.

Second
column266: we had no convenient way to automate recurring gifts. Now
column267: our monthly pledges are processed automatically
column268:
and I'm told IATS is working on an upgrade that will allow us to do the same with annual pledges.

Third
column269: we were paying a lot of money in Paypal processing fees for online donations
column270: and had a fairly clunky interface. And
column271: this resulted in a time-consuming series of processes because we had to re-key the donor information into Salesforce
column272: and manually transfer the funds from Paypal to our bank account. When we shopped around
column273: we found most options were either very expensive
column274: or were going to require a lot of customization to create a donor interface. With IATS (and some very cost-effective custom web design by Idealist Consulting)
column275:
we now have a secure online donor page which (a) puts the funds directly into our checking account and (b) puts the donor information directly into Salesforce.

On the whole
column285: 'review_description': 'When we were in the process of converting from Etapestry to Salesforce we looked at what we liked about Etapestry. One of these items was its integration with IATS. For non-profits such as ours
column286: IATS is the only way to go. They are reliable
column287: their fee per transaction is the lowest in the industry
column288:
and throughout our time with them there have been no problems whatsoever. How many vendors can you say that about?

I contacted IATS to see if they had any integration with Salesforce. At the time they did not
column289:
but they were working on an App. We felt so strongly about IATS as a company we decided to wait for their App to be completed as opposed to switching to another payment processor that had integration with Salesforce. It was worth the wait.

While this app is not EVERYTHING I want it to be yet
column290:
I have no doubt it will be soon. Here is what it can do for you:
1) Allows you to run your own credit cards from within Salesforce at the Account
column292:
or Opportunity Level.
2) The way the app is configured allows you to integrate it with every flavor of Salesforce you might have including Person Accounts
column295: and even our own unique configuration of Opportunity in which we have created a Transaction related object to handle payments made in an Opportunity (pledges
column297:
etc)
3) IATS gives you the html code so you can configure your own online donation page. If you have ever worked with web-to-lead webpage setup
column298: it is not different from this. Once the online donation is submitted
column299:
an Opportunity is automatically created. From there you link your opportunity to the appropriate account and/or contact using lookup fields.
4) I suspect it would be advantageous for any non-profit to acquire this app now and be a part of the continual upgrades that will be made to this App. They have already made improvements based on a number of my suggestions.'}

column67:
'review_description': 'We are an ISV and Salesforce consulting partner who use quite a wide range of AppExchange products in customer implementations.

Prior to discovering Asperato hooking up payment gateways for card payments was always a real pain on deployments and getting a satisfactory and compliant solution for DDs near impossible. Asperato has pretty much eliminated these major headaches for us and our customers.'}
column75:
'review_description': 'We have used Asperato for over a year for card and direct debit payments for our County Council Green Waste service. The support on original implementation was excellent and was a massive help to us in delivering the project. We have always felt valued as a customer and all the staff that we have spoken to have been knowledgeable and professional.

The main thing however is that the application just works as designed and both takes one-off payments as well as fires direct debits. Integration to our payment providers were delivered smoothly and the complex area of taking payments is made simple by the Asperato solution. Internally we take payments over the phone but also customers self-service to allow both channels to create direct debits and make one-off payments. The solution appears simple but Asperato solves a major headache in taking payments.

Advice and guidance on areas such as PCI
column76: approaching new use cases has been excellent and I would recommend this solution to anyone considering taking payments via Salesforce.'}
column84:
'review_description': 'We have used the Asperato Payment since 2012. We are very happy with the system & the service.
We use the online payment processing both for our Salesforce users to take payments but also to take payments on our website. Then the system automatically creates the payments in Salesforce. This replaced PDQ machines which required duplicate entry of the amount & daily reonciliation to manage keying errors. It allows us to be PCI compliant.
Over the years we have had advice from the Technical Director Adrian Naude who has really added benefit. His extensive industry experience helped us avoid issues & consider exceptions such as refunds. The support team are always very responsive
column85:
although we rarely ever have to contact them!
They have a lot of happy customers but are not strong at Marketing themselves so you will not find lots of review on app exchange.'}
column93: 'review_description': 'We’re been using Asperato in SalesForce since September 2015 to integrate both card and direct-debit payments. The support we receive is excellent - always timely and responsive

We have complex custom requirements around our payment process; the additional work to support this was performed promptly and efficiently. column80: 'review_description': "We use Taskfeed to monitor Deployments and PoCs - we used to have issues managing customer expectations and how long they took
column81: some of our PoCs could go on and on which meant our tech team were being kept from focusing on some other more important tasks. column82: they just have to log into Salesforce and drag and drop the activities that have been completed. Everyone in the team has visibility of this so the sales team are always aware of the progress from the tech team. With External sharing

column84: we can customise our usual templates to fit the customer's needs if necessary. Since using Taskfeed we have managed to improve our team's productivity as well as our customer service."}

A brilliant solution to an in-house project management tool that required manual input. I would recommend this product to any company that needs visibility and accountability in their business.'}

'review_description': 'My team at Salesforce utilizes Taskfeed to manage the changes and upgrades for our sales demonstration orgs. We were also very impressed with their ability to innovate and release new features on a regular cadence over the last two years.

The last point that I would like to make is regarding their exceptional support. Andy is not only responsive but incredibly knowledgeable about how we should be using the solution to best meet our needs.'}

column322: 'review_description': 'We use Taskfeed at Salesforce to manage the release process for changes and upgrades to our sales demonstration orgs. We manage changes for over 10 different orgs on different release cycles with different owners and contributors. The security model allows us to give owners full visibility to what is going on in a Kanban board
column323:
and contributors see only the tasks that they are working on. It\'s allowed us to collaborate with a diverse group of individuals within the company on a given release.

We\'ve also been able to customize Taskfeed to our use case - we have a "light" agile methodology for how we develop our releases so we didn\'t need the bells and whistles associated with burn down rates
column324: etc. So we simply removed those things from the UI
column325:
added our own custom fields to track what we needed and we now have a solution that is very much tailored to how we work.

Taskfeed has innovated rapidly - we are very please with the changes we\'ve seen. We started using it about 1 year ago and we\'ve seen amazing improvements to both the UI and the functionality.

Last but not least
column326: the support we\'ve received has been great. Andy is very responsive and knowledgable and has advised us on how to best make use of the solution given our use case. We have a partnership that has made us successful using the tool.'}

column265:
others seem to lack vision and important key features.

I was pleasantly surprised then when I had a chance to see ServiceMax in depth on more than one occasion. What impressed me was both the depth and breadth of the functionality of the solution
column266: especially from a relatively new solution. It includes all of the core capabilities any service or maintenance organization requires
column272: and much more. I'd say it compares very favorably with the better known and longer established service management software vendors. I've also witnessed the speed with which they can develop robust new functionality
column273:
a capability that will certainly serve both their company and their customers well going forward.

The fact that it sits on the Salesforce Force.com platform as a Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) solution should also be attractive to companies from a total cost of ownership standpoint. SaaS solutions are gaining momentum and are expected to become a more standard method or implementing software going forward. There is clearly no better platform than Salesforce.com on which to base the SaaS model

Based on my extensive experience in the service business

column20:
2019 --After nearly 3 years since this review it still doesn\'t work properly. These people don\'t even care. We have put in 15+ tickets and they don\'t even bother to respond.

We have been involved with the Counterpath app going on 18 months. We were their first installed client for this app

We have had problems from day one and they have not been able to fix a very critical problem. Every call transaction is supposed to be logged in Salesforce as an activity object occurrence. Approximately 25% of these transactions are never logged in Salesforce. These activity records are critical for us because we aggregate them to measure call center agent productivity. So losing 25% of the transactions makes our statistics useless. Counterpath blames Salesforce and refuses to take responsibility. They tell us to open a ticket with Salesforce. Salesforce always responds with the same thing. "We don\'t support third party applications" I think that Counterpath is over their head and doesn\'t have enough Salesforce expertise to fix the problem. We are looking for a replacement app for this application that Counterpath refuses to support.'}

column56: misspelled) won't pass tests in your org because it assumes you have Profilees named 'NotAccessible1'
column58: 'NotCreatable' and 'NotUpdatable' with varying levels of CRUD access to User
column60:
and Case_Status_Change__c objects.

You need to make test class without sharing; and in testSetup
column61:
create the Case using a system admin user.

You can fix test: 'testAccessible1' by using Profile 'Force.com - One App User'. You can fix test 'testAccessible2' by using profile 'Read Only'. Personally
column62: I'd comment out the testCreatable and testUpdatable test methods if not also testAccessible1 and testAccessible2"}

column78: 'review_title': 'Pro tip for Custom Community User Profiles and Business Hours'
column80:
it actually won't grant access to the Case_Status_Changes__c object to your custom community profile. You'll need to give Read-Create-Edit-Delete access to the object AND check Edit for all of the fields in this object as well.

The trigger handler code only calculates Case Status age for the default Business Hours. It does not look at the value of Case.BusinessHoursId to fetch the relevant business hours for the case in question. Strongly recommend enhancing the code to do this."}
